abstract.t: DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) defines a domain-levelauthentication framework for email to permit verification of thesource and contents of messages. This document specifies an adjunctmechanism to aid in assessing messages that do not contain a DKIMsignature for the domain used in the author's address. It defines arecord that can advertise whether they sign their outgoing mail, andhow other hosts can access those records.
